result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda F. Fox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Cassandra Laczkowski
Write a letter of apology to Cassandra Laczkowski and provide to agent for review.
Comply with conditions of bond as stated in Marathon County case(s).
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Submit DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.

PLEA/SENTENCING:
3:18 p.m.  Case is recalled.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
No PSI to be requested by either party.
Recusal form completed by Atty Lueschow.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 and Count 1 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lueschow makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 -
4 year prison term with 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision **Imposed/Stayed
Placed on probation for 24 months to run concurrent to Marathon County Case(s)
